item.title: E-commerce Attribution: Necessary vs. Sufficient Causation
item.description: The attribution problem: necessary vs. sufficient conditions of causation The tools of causal inference–particularly the concepts of necessary and sufficient causation–are central to solving the e-commerce attribution problem. The e-commerce attribution problem is: how much of the value of an outcome should we ascribe to a given customer touch point out of a set of touch points that preceded the outcome? For example, a customer buys a t-shirt.
